result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:28 PM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Edward A Kraemer in court.  Attorney Laura Ann Walker Esq in court for Edward A Kraemer. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Defendant to plea to Cts. 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, dri balance.  State recommends 1 yrs. IC, 1 yrs. ES on each count, concurrent to each other, imposed and stayed for 3 yrs. probation, conditions as stated on the record.

PLEA: Cts. 4, 5, 6, 7, 8: G
BTC: Cts. 4, 5, 6, 7, 8: GUILTY.  Cts. 1, 2, 3, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15, 16 and 22CF130: DRI.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Defendant to comply with DOC terms and regulations. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

records.addlTxt: Atty Alexander Kostal
Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

***ALSO $1,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator), between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM on the day of your release/court appearance.  Weekend or night releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am - 4:30 pm)  **NOTE: A $210 advance fee for installment of the SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.** Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
